name: summer house crochet bag

❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️


the **summer house crochet bag** is the epitome of practicality and style. this versatile accessory merges the convenience of a cross-body fanny pack with the charm of crochet craftsmanship, offering hands-free ease for on-the-go adventures.


this beautifully textured bag is made in one piece, side to side, with increases and decreases in the third loop. then, we will seam the ends and attach a fun strap for added flair.

[this cross-body bag pattern comes with a video tutorial.][1]


crochet hook:
[g (4.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][2]


notions:
[removable stitch marker][3]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][4]
[scissors][5]
[cross-body strap][6]


yarn:
[dishie cotton][7]
100% cotton, 190yds/100g

or

[comfy worsted][8]
75% pima cotton, 25% acrylic, 109yds/50g

yarn substitutes:
[comfy color mist][9]
75% pima cotton, 25% acrylic, 219yds/100g

[lion brand made with love][10]
60% cotton, 40% acrylic, 185yds/100g


yardage:
solid color: 225 yds; 2 balls


abbreviations
ch - chain
blo - back loop only
hdc - half double crochet
hdc2tog - half double crochet two together
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)


gauge:
22 sts and 15 rows = 4" by 4"  in hdc in the third loop


not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][11]


sizes:
one size - bag is 15 inches at its widest, with a body depth of 6 inches. 


skill level:
advanced beginner
